name: hoopoe

an orange-pink bird found in Africa, Asia, and Europe, with a beak that curves downwards, a large crest (= feathers that stand up on its head) and black and white wings and tail: The hoopoe is a striking-looking songbird whose name is meant to imitate its strange whooping call. Birdlife is under threat here, but you can still see hoopoes, doves, and woodpeckers.
